channel.title: Comments on: Bluehost Sponsoring WordCamp Utah 2010 Lunch

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/08/16/bluehost-sponsoring-wordcamp-utah-2010-lunch/#comment-3524">Marj Wyatt</a>.
The other option would be to pay for the upgrade fee :-)
For info on WordCamp events keep an eye on http://central.wordcamp.org/.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Marj Wyatt.

The other option would be to pay for the upgrade fee üôÇ

For info on WordCamp events keep an eye on http://central.wordcamp.org/.

item.title: By: Marj Wyatt
item.dc:creator: Marj Wyatt
item.description:
Blue Host is a great hosting service and a good value for the price. In my daily work, I've set up several Wordpress Websites for people who use Blue Host.
One observation that I do have about them, however, is that they do not provide full support for multi-site Wordpress installations without an upgrade fee. Since this is where most of my clients want to be, I can't recommend that service anymore. :(
I know it would be great to network with other Wordpress experts face-to-face and plan to attend one of the WordCamp events soon. When is WordCamp coming to San Diego? :)
Speaking of faces, the catering company sounds as though they produce great cuisine too!
item.content:encoded:
Blue Host is a great hosting service and a good value for the price. In my daily work, I’ve set up several WordPress Websites for people who use Blue Host.

One observation that I do have about them, however, is that they do not provide full support for multi-site WordPress installations without an upgrade fee. Since this is where most of my clients want to be, I can’t recommend that service anymore. üôÅ

I know it would be great to network with other WordPress experts face-to-face and plan to attend one of the WordCamp events soon. When is WordCamp coming to San Diego? üôÇ

Speaking of faces, the catering company sounds as though they produce great cuisine too!
